data.name: Windows File Class (Very Easy)
data.description:
# Task
Create the ```File``` class, for more information see <u>Detail</u>

# Detail
## Name
### Basic Name
Set Function: ```File.prototype.rename(name)```

Get It: ```File.name1```

Default: ```file```
#### Example
```javascript
let Test = new File();
Test.rename("test");
console.log(Test.name1) // test
```
### Extend Name
Set Function: ```File.prototype.setExpandname(expand_name)```

Get It: ```File.name2```

Default: ```txt```
#### Example
```javascript
let Test = new File();
Test.setExpandname("exe");
console.log(Test.name2) // exe
```
### Full Name
Get It: ```File.fullname```
#### Example
```javascript
let Test = new File();
Test.rename("example");
Test.setExpandname("html");
console.log(Test.fullname) // example.html
```
## Link File
If file's expand name is ```lnk``` then allow use it.
### To
Set Function: ```File.prototype.setattr_linkto(linkto)```

Get It: ```File.linkto```
#### Example
```javascript
let Test = new File();
Test.setExpandname("lnk");
Test.setattr_linkto("1.exe")
console.log(Test.linkto) // ./1.exe
```
#### Special
If this attribute is set to begin with anything other than ```/```, the display begins with the insertion of ```./```
## Content
### File Content
Set Function: ```File.prototype.write(content)```

Get It: ```File.content```

Default: ```.```
#### Example
```javascript
let Test = new File();
Test.write("hello world");
console.log(Test.content) // hello world
```
## Action: Delete
Function: ```File.prototype.delete()```
### Example
```javascript
let Test = new File();
Test.delete();
console.log(Test.fullname,Test.content) // undefined undefined
```
